snippet: In Peter Gelb’s tenure at the Metropolitan Opera, new productions by living composers have been rare, despite his stated goal of bringing the company into the 21st century.
abstract: Thomas Ades' opera The Tempest, directed by Robert Lepage, is one of the few new productions by living composers debuting at the Metropolitan Opera during Peter Gelb's tenure as general manager.
lead_paragraph: In Peter Gelb’s tenure at the Metropolitan Opera, new productions by living composers have been rare, despite his stated goal of bringing the company into the 21st century.

headline.seo: New Operas at the Met Prove to Be Rare Breed
headline.main: A Rare Breed: New Operas at the Met
headline.print_headline: A Rare Breed: New Operas At the Met
